posts.content:
Look forward to seeing them...and discussions on fitting.
I stripped my OG seats...
Took the covers off taking care not to spike myself with the spikes through the covers...They are pliable but take care they snap
Saved the fine iron wire but did not reuse... get some from DIY store
Took the wadding off
Took the hair pads off nay be held with iron wire
Stripped the spring pack off the frame
Had the frame shot blasted and powder coated black
Had the spring pack gently blasted
Checked for broken springs
Replaced eight
Dave blew the springs over with a matt black paint
Used 14oz hessian wired on to cover the springs
VwH coconut fibre pads
New wadding
TMI covers with gas welding rod in pocket pulled over spikes
Soft iron wire through pocket all around skirt
Fit..
Had to hunt for asnd replace the knurled adjusting bolts on the drivers seat..Mine were rusted solid and sheared trying to get them out..
No slide catch knob but I got one from an auto jumble
Fit

Thanks for that.

Sounds like fun. Looking forward to giving them a go, It'll mean I'm nearly finished the bus (Wahooo) Will let you know when they arrive

Cheers

Jim

I got bench seat cover in my garage I ordered my door cards and seat cover from https://www.wolfsburgwest.com/wolfsburg ... cfm?type=2
